p: The yield (appearance and color) of each extract is represented in Table 1. The results showed that the hydro-ethanol extracts of different parts of A. pyrethrum (L.) varieties have two aspects: pasty and powdery with two different colors (green and brown). The maximum yield was obtained from A. P var. pyrethrum root extracts (16%), followed by the leaves and capitula extracts (14%), while the seeds presented the lowest yield (10%). In contrast, the extraction from A. P var. depressus (Ball) Maire presented the lowest yield (capitula: 6%; roots: 13%).
